pageContext.claim: “And they [China] don't even enter the agreement until 2030.”
pageContext.analysis: On a per capita basis, the United States in 2015 produced more than double the carbon dioxide emissions of China .  China, in its submission to the Paris accord, said that, compared to 2005 levels, it would seek to cut its carbon emissions by 60 to 65 percent per unit of GDP by 2030. Note that China pledged to reach these goals by 2030, meaning they are taking steps now to meet their commitments.
